Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as elevator door closes] Hold it!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [notices something new about Dwight] New glasses.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dwight. What a ridiculous, fancy clown you are.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am dressed according to the Schrute codes of mourning. My aunt Shirley has died.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Dwight. I'm so sorry. Were you guys close?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would say that she raised me, but let's not kid each other. I raised myself. She was, however, the closest thing I had to a mother.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My actual mother was very cold and distant. I'd say she was the closest thing I had to an aunt.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: My condolences.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Keep them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. Now, what do we got in these two pails?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In keeping with Schrute custom, I will either invite you to Saturday's funeral by sprinkling red, fertile dirt in your face. Or, I will ask you to keep a respectful distance during my time of grief, with a dusting of black, slightly acidic soil.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [after Dwight tosses dirt on her face] What color is it?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It looks pretty black.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [after Dwight tosses dirt in his face] Yep. Acidic, all right.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [while Dwight prepares to toss dirt] Oh, thank god.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm so sorry, Dwight. And if you want me to be there, of course I will go. I just... have a personal training session...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK. That's not... [tosses red dirt in Oscar's face]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I get red dirt. Nobody is getting red dirt. I should've kept my mouth shut. We're not even that close. I've only known Dwight... 12 years. 12 years. Time is a son of a bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [as Dwight prepares to throw dirt in his face] I'm sure... I'm sure she's in a better place.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I really hope so. [unexpectedly tosses dirt in Pam's face]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK. [as Dwight mixes coffee with dirt in his hand] This is crazy. You can't make a dirt ball.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I miss her so much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know? [Dwight screams and throws dirt ball at Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: [playing guitar and singing 'Oh What a Beautiful Morning'] Zeke's here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Zeke.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Hey, Dwight. Mose, Mom says 'hi'.

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: 'Hi' to Mom.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Mose
Quote.Text: Will there be ghosts there?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [simultaneously with Zeke] Get in the sidecar. Get in the sidecar.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: You get in the sidecar.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [at the grave site, to Oscar] What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You invited me. You threw the red dirt in my face.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [smirking] Oh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [as a car approaches the grave site] Who is that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jeb, my brother.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You have a brother?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: I didn't really see a better parking spot. [drives into the dug grave] Whoa! Look what I did. It's a rental. [Dwight approaches and hugs him] You wanna go in? [both attempt to put the other in the dug grave]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [upon seeing Todd Packer enter the office] Oh, gosh.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Hey, Moonface. Nice to see those shiny, little Chinese eyes of yours.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [to Pam] Who's this guy?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ... bad.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Hi, all.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Why are you here, Todd?

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: OK. Let's get right to it. I guess. My name is Todd Packer and I am in recovery. I'm working the steps. I'm on step eight of Alcoholics Anonymous and step nine of Narcotics Anonymous. I'm here to make amends. I've been hard to deal with over the past years. Kind of a jerk. I know it. I don't need you to accept my apology, but I'd love it if you did.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Packer, we accept. [others disagree]

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Actually, they have a specific way I need to do this. And, I have to go through examples of stuff. OK. Uh, where to begin. [to Pam] Hey. Pam-pam and her pam-pams. Wow. I have said some crude things about those. But, they are beautiful. And, I guess that's why I acted out. Pam, I'm sorry I objectified you. And, personified your breasts. Sorry, guys. [to Phyllis] Oh boy. I have not been nice to you. Philly, I'm sorry for the things I said about your size. To your face, behind your back, and in the form of drawings. Actually, that goes to all you double XLs. Stanley, Kevin, [points to Clark] this kid in a few years.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Todd, you're just saying insults in the form of an apology.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Why can't I just be nice? Truth is, I really like you guys. I really do. OK. The apology's just half of it. The big thing is making amends. And, that's why I brought these. I went out to the Steamtown Mall and I got you all cupcakes. From that place 'Nipples'.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I think it's called 'Nibbles'.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Huh. The mind sees what it wants to, huh? [hands cupcake to Erin] There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, guys. Wait. Before we accept these cupcakes, I think we need to have a conversation privately in the conference room. Don't eat the cupcake.

Quote.Speaker: German Minister
Quote.Text: We are here today to join this woman and the ground. Man is born of woman and his life is full of turmoil.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: [gathers and tastes soil] Huh. It's crap soil. Nothing's going to grow here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Doesn't matter. It's a cemetery.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: Yeah, well, I'm just saying it's garbage soil, that's all.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, the only thing we're planting here is dead bodies.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: It's fine 'cause they're not going to grow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, thank god they're not because we don't want to make zombies.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: Good. I agree. Don't worry about it. You won't get any.

Quote.Speaker: German Minister
Quote.Text: Would the family care to say something?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You had black hair and then gray hair.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: You were the aunt to my cousins. Most of your life you were 5'4", at the end you were 5'1".

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: They're a descriptive people.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: [approaches and hugs Dwight] I see you started without me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You were late. So, what am I supposed to do?

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Well, I told you...

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: Hi, Fannie.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Who is that?

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Dwight's sister.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Dwight has a sister?

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: She's beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Blugh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [to his nephew Cameron] Hello, little man. Haven't seen you in a few years. [after a weak handshake] What is this? Oh, god. [after a truck with many girls in the bed pulls up] Henry.

Quote.Speaker: Henry
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I see Esther's back in town.

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: Hi Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi Esther. Nice of you to come today.

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: This was on the way. We're going into town after. I need yarn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, if you can snap two chicken necks with a single motion, why use two motions to slaughter those chickens.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: We're at a funeral. There's a funeral going on here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Henry
Quote.Text: Anyone mention her height?

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Henry
Quote.Text: Land size? [all shake heads] [removes hat] Shirley, at 1600 acres, you have the largest farm in the area. Sharing borders with six other farms. Including my own farm. And your nephew Dwight's. [replaces hat] OK. [drives away]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, let's get it going.

Quote.Speaker: German Minister
Quote.Text: [approaches Fannie, offering a shotgun] Would you want to do the honors?

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Oh, right. Uh, you know, I don't think we have to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We Schrutes don't need some Harvard doctor to tell us who's alive and who's dead. But, there was an unlucky streak of burying some heavy sleepers. And, when grave robbers discovered some scratch marks on the inside of some of the coffins, we decided to make sure that our dead were completely dead. Out of kindness.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [after Dwight opens coffin and begins firing into it] That's it for me. [exits]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think we should eat Packers' cupcakes. We can't give him the satisfaction.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I agree. Even though that place has a way of making those cupcakes so they're dense. But, they're also really fluffy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We can't let him buy our forgiveness with cupcakes. He was awful to us. And, he still is. How much is a cupcake? $2.50? Is that the price of our dignity?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: $3.75 a cupcake, actually. $3.67 if you buy a dozen.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I never forget a number. Names? In one ear and out the other. Places? Nope. Faces? That's rich. But, numbers? I have a gift. I guess that's why I'm an accountant.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey, man. I don't think we've met. I'm Clark.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Oh. I'm Todd. Oh, sorry for calling you a fat, little runt earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You didn't actually say that.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: No? Wow. I'm in this mode now where I'm apologizing for thoughts that are in my head. [Clark fake laughs] Hey. I have a crazy feeling [hands Clark a cupcake] that you are really gonna like this.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Maybe we should eat the cupcakes. Haven't we done enough to Packer? I mean, we sent him down to Florida on a prank. [to Nellie] And you did fire him.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I did. I did, yes. And it was purely political. He did nothing wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Would any of you be saying any of this if the cupcakes were from Supermart?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Do they even have a bakery anymore?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: They do. It's awful. And, it's getting worse every day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, it really is just about the cupcakes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow, you're right. It is just about the cupcakes.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: So, we're all agreed? No one touches those cupcakes?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [as all agree] OK.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: OK. Packer can go to hell.

Quote.Speaker: Aunt Shirley
Quote.Text: [on a recorded video] Thank you for coming to my funeral. As I gaze at life's big sunset, I can't help but wonder where it all went wrong. You've all disappointed me greatly. Fannie. A single mamma in the city.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [agreeing with Shirley] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Aunt Shirley
Quote.Text: Jeb. A street pusher.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: After I left the army, I bought a 9-acre worm farm from a Californian. Turns out "worm" means something else out there. And, I am now in the business of... pain management. Or, the smoking of pain management.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't stand the fact that Jeb is a pot farmer. He could've grown anything. Anything in the world. He used to talk about growing a peanut-grape hybrid. One plant, one sandwhich.

Quote.Speaker: Aunt Shirley
Quote.Text: We can't just sit by and watch our family farm disappear. So, here are my terms. Dwight, Fannie, Jeb. If you come back home, I will leave you my farm. So, there, you have it.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Is she crazy? [as Dwight considers] Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: Buddy? Buddy?

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: No, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: Snap out of it. Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's do this. Let's run Aunt Shirley's farm. I'm in. Boom.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: No, no, no. I'm not moving back here. Are you crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of course you are.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Look. I, I don't want to be mean or like insulting. I know that you like it here. But, Dwight, it's just that farm life lacks a certain... sort of sophistication.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: That Cammy and I are drawn to. And, I don't know. The men are just... it's almost like there's a... a willing ignorance.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Yes. I, thank you for asking me. I actually have written a little bit of poetry. That's crazy. And, I was recently published. Which is just... [reaches in to bag, removes folded paper] maybe I have. Yep. I do. Here it is from the um, Hartford Women's Lit Quarterly.com. A Willing Ignorance by Fannie Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: Totally. Yep. The people here are like [makes farting sound, laughs] Like a fart. You know what I'm saying? Like a fart?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? Let's take a couple of nights and stay here and think about Aunt Shirley's offer.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: Couple of nights couldn't hurt.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Uh, somehow how I think a couple of nights could hurt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You will say 'yes' on one. Five, four, three, two, get ready to say 'yes', one. Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: [as Dwight says 'yes'] Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Zeke
Quote.Text: Growing up with Dwight and Mose was not easy. Uh, Dwight was obviously the cool one. And, Mose was the visionary. Which left me to be the comedian.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: That doesn't work on me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: By the way, that's not...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [counts down in French]

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Very funny. OK. Oui, oui, oui.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oui.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Oh my goodness.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [while everyone is gathered playing and singing "Sons & Daughters"] People underestimate the power of nostalgia. If baseball can use it to get people to care about that worthless sport, then I can use it to get my siblings to care about the farm. Nostalgia is truly one of the great human weaknesses. Second only to the neck.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: [after seeing Dwight lay something down in front of Esther] So, I forgot about this old custom. If a man is interested in courting a woman, he may throw the beaks of a crow at her. And then, if she's interested in accepting the courtship, she has to destroy the beaks. [Esther crushes the beaks leaving Dwight satisfied]

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Hey, uh, I just wanted to say I'm sorry for screwing you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm not sorry about it.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: I am. It was my rock bottom.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [while Kevin stares at his cupcake] Kevin, you can do this.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You don't know that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kevin, um, let's think of something to distract us. Uh, like the movie Skyfall. You loved the movie Skyfall, right?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: James Bond was a spy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. He was a good spy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. He was the best. James Bond would love this cupcake.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Hey, you know what? It was, uh, great to see you all again. Take care. [exits]

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: I am going through a twelve-step program. I'm currently on step zero. Which is have a [expletive] of fun. I spent six hours carefully removing the frosting and then layering in a variety of drugs, some legal, some not. Some laxative, some constipating. You don't fire the Pac-Man and expect to get away with it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Guys, I'm proud of us. I think we did the right thing. [after noticing Angela easting cupcake] Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [as others eat] Wait!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: He's gone. It's just a cupcake now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no. It's the principle of the thing.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [exits office, chewing] Oh my god. I forgive him so much. [Kevin begins making choking sounds] Whoa, is he choking?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [after long choking and refusing help from Meredith] Oh, that was fantastic.

Quote.Speaker: Cameron
Quote.Text: [after following Dwight to the chicken coop, before sunrise] Is it dangerous to take the eggs in front of them?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, very. You really need to stand back because these are killer chickens.

Quote.Speaker: Cameron
Quote.Text: I was just asking you something I didn't know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which is fine. And, you learned something. But, it was kind of a stupid question so you're gonna get made fun of a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Cameron
Quote.Text: [after grabbing an egg] Are we gonna eat these today?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If you want.

Quote.Speaker: Cameron
Quote.Text: Is that a guillotine?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This? No. That'd be cool, though. It's for milking.

Quote.Speaker: Cameron
Quote.Text: [referencing goat] That's a cow?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you just ask me if this was a cow?

Quote.Speaker: Cameron
Quote.Text: [after seeing Dwight smelling milk] What are you doing now?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come here. Come on. Grab a teat with each hand. Sit down. There you go. Squeeze from top to bottom. Really pull. Use some muscle. Draw the milk out. All right. Going all right?

Quote.Speaker: Cameron
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, is the udder hot? Is the milk clumpy?

Quote.Speaker: Cameron
Quote.Text: I don't know any of that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, you suck at this. Give me those teats. Didn't your father teach you anything?

Quote.Speaker: Cameron
Quote.Text: I never met him.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good morning, Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [looking disheveled] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, everybody. Um, I decided to eat my cupcake. I thought about it last night. I talked to Jim. I talked to my sister. And, I think that, as long as Todd Packer doesn't know, it's OK.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't care what you do, Pam. Just please stop making noise.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Packer laced the cupcakes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Did you get diarrhea or were you stoned?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Some of us got both. [raises hand]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my god! Is everyone OK?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Last night, I got out all of my old dolls and played with them on the living room floor. Then, I ordered ten American Girl outfits online. It was thousands of dollars.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yeah? Well, count yourself lucky, Phyllis. I got the toilet.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Me too. [holds up four fingers]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I went Christmas caroling in March and I fertilized some bushes along the way. So, not my best night. But, not my worst night.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What did you do, Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Last night? Oh, god, um, I don't know. [cuts to him arm wrestling Kevin] Na, nothing really. Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Why would you ask me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm not, a... I'm just. I don't know. [cuts to him spinning a plate like a record and Kevin dancing] Oh. Gosh. I actually. It is hard to recall. Um. [cuts to he and Kevin sitting on a table touching each others face] Pretty normal night.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [he and Andy embrace each other in tears] My night was just like that. [cuts to him and Andy trading clothes] Meaning normal.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. I didn't see you last night at all. [cuts to him dancing by prostrate Kevin]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Nope. I did not see you either.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow. He is officially the worst human being.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [as Pam attempts to throw cupcake away] Ah. [stops Pam and takes cupcake]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But, Kevin that's...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. No, I understand, Pam. I understand.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [shaking head in disbelief] No.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: So, that's it. I just wanted to make amends. [slides cupcakes across table to Darryl and Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's big of you, man. Takes a lot of courage.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh, red velvet. I should apologize too.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: It's OK. I'm over it.

Quote.Speaker: Jeb
Quote.Text: Oof. This is no nine-acre worm farm. This is a beast. Whoever's managing this thing is gonna have a hell of a job. Not it.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: Not it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It. [to Fannie] That kid doesn't put in some farm time, he's gonna stay like that.

Quote.Speaker: Fannie
Quote.Text: All right.
